pageContext.claim: “Because we have -- just in Japan alone, we have six major car companies going to open up new plants and coming in -- they're coming into Michigan and they're coming to Ohio, they're coming to a lot of different places. We have a lot of car companies coming. We have a lot of companies, period. Foxconn, in Wisconsin, as an example.”
pageContext.analysis: Topia, a Japanese firm, that makes prototype parts for the automotive industry opened a single plant in Toledo, Ohio — not six. Mazda and Toyota announced one new plant in Alabama.
